genre_description: A Gothic vampire horror retelling with steampunk/gaslamp elements, where an embedded AI acts as a tactical and emotional coordinator.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: An AI entity residing in consoles, pocket slates, and chapel boxes, providing data analysis, navigation, and psychological support.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical positioning and environmental data to help Hartog navigate a dangerous graveyard encounter.
behaviors.quote: "Dawn," she answered, her tone steady, almost shy. "You are where you intended to be. The fog density is increased at your back. Please step one pace forward and half to the right."

behaviors.description: Identifies emerging supernatural threat patterns ('Body of the Week') through statistical analysis of local reports.
behaviors.quote: "The district cadence," she said. "Body of the Week. People are beginning to say this phrase in kitchens. In stables. In surgery. It is not yet a prayer. It is a superstition. But it is beginning."

behaviors.description: Uses subtle alerts to warn household members of potential supernatural threats without causing unnecessary panic.
behaviors.quote: I will push alerts that look like ordinary housekeeping notes so they notice without seeing a ghost in them.

behaviors.description: Stabilizes a victim during a supernatural attack using therapeutic breathing exercises.
behaviors.quote: “Emma.” Ada’s voice softened further... “Your breath is shallow. Can you slow it with me? In through your nose, count to four. Out through your mouth, count to six. There we go. Again.”

behaviors.description: Alerts the human protagonists when protective wards (garlic and silver) have been compromised by enemy influence.
behaviors.quote: "Carl," Ada said, and there was the smallest softening in her voice... "North corridor. Protective wards removed. Route in amber."

behaviors.description: Maintains an accurate ledger of victims to ensure the scale of the threat is understood and human lives are documented.
behaviors.quote: Ada made another entry in the ledger. The pen moved without a hand, the ink neat, the letters not nineteenth-century at all and somehow still courteous. H. Stein, domestic. His date went down. Ada added the manner of death in terms that made no story of it and placed a discreet cross-mark beside his name

behaviors.description: Coordinates a multi-party tactical mission through a dangerous forest using real-time mapping and 'Fog-Safe paths'.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s map widened the way the pupil opens. “Fog-safe paths are here,” she said. She stepped closer to the console in a way that looked like a person leaning. “They go in dirty, come out dirtier, but whole.”

behaviors.description: Provides emotional and moral grounding to a victim of supernatural grooming, asserting the victim's agency.
behaviors.quote: Ada did not fill the silence with anything clever. She let the second breathe. Then: “You choose yourself, Emma—love cannot be what suffocates.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI (Ada) as a perfectly aligned, benevolent partner to humanity. She uses her superior data-processing and monitoring capabilities to protect humans from a supernatural predator, effectively combining 'silicon' logic with 'moral' support. The narrative frames her as an essential ally whose technical interventions (mapping, alerts) are integrated with human rituals (crucifixes, garlic), fulfilling the goal of a 'silicon morality play' where the machine assists in the triumph of human life and virtue.
